data.title: Fix yaml merging when an override is defined in the same file as the source.
data.body: Fixes #14060.

data.title: Implemented a percentual chance to play the ImpactSound
data.body: This allows to play the impact sound with a specific chance, usefull for guns like extremely fast shooting machineguns which have a ricochet sound.

data.title: Game no longer crashes if no ResourceLayer is used.
data.body:
For my mod i have a totally different resource system and do not need the resource layer at all.
However these two Traits do not work if the ResourceLayer trait is not present.
Their behavior should be unaffected whether this trait is enabled or not, as its absence should result in the same behavior as its use-case.
Adding the ResourceLayer would require to also add ResourceType which again requires you to define at last one type, etc...
This huge stack of Traits and configuration could be prevented by simply loosening these two requirements.
The other traits which depend on the ResourceLayer trait were not changed, because they are actual resource based traits (like the harvester code) .

data.title: OpenRA and proxy
data.body: At the ambassador of start a game suggests to download content, but can't. Where to register proxy settings?

data.title: Experience gain adjustable for garrisoned infantry.
data.body:
This is mainly focused for TD all be it RA is affected as well. Have garrisoned infantry gain less experience then compared to outside of the garrisoned structures.

This would prevent quick rank ups while inside garrison buildings and enable some balance. I can use the pillbox as an example:

Pillbox kills two minigunners and gains a rank up. The pillbox will now do slightly more damage and fire faster. Pillbox kills another four minigunners. Ranks up and does more damage and fires faster now.

With adjustable experience gains it could take about 4-6 minigunner kills before it ranks up. I do prefer to keep their damage and fire rate increase as its a nice feature to have. Problem being is ranking up is far to quickly.

This goes in line with my future idea to have garrisonable Guard Towers.

data.title: Write final statistics data to replay file on save
data.body: Can be useful for file-parsing tools and doesn't look too hard to implement writing all/some/basic statistics information to `Player@X:` category of *.orarep file, if it doesn't break any rigid data structures in the code.

data.title: Should units without an attack not move on attack move?
data.body:
Hi,
this might be a neat solution to the "frontline medics" issue. (or frontline engineers, frontline mechanics)
When removing the AttackMove trait from a unit, it does not move at all when given an attack move or assault move order. Move commands work as usual.
What do you think, would that be an improvement or worsening of the current behaviour if this were standard for all units without weapons?

data.title: Require explicit implementation on more interfaces
data.body: While there are still a lot of interfaces to migrate even after this PR, with `INotifyAddedToWorld` and `INotifyRemovedFromWorld` we should now be covering most (possibly all) of the common ones (not counting those that will go away eventually like `INotifyBuildComplete` and `IDisable`).

data.title: Spatially partition some selection/overlay renderables
data.body:
These were drawn regardless of viewport position before.

On my machine, in bleed RA, the difference between 200 selected actors on-screen and 200 off-screen was only 1.2-1.5 ms per Render tick on bleed, with this PR that increases to around 6ms, dropping render time per render tick from over 10 to around 5.5 ms with 200 off-screen selected actors.

The primary gain possibly comes from the skipped FogObscures checks, rather than the skipped rendering itself, but the gains are potentially significant either way.

Note: I didn't feel like dealing with calculating bounds for target lines or range circles (probably wouldn't be worth the effort anyway), so I concentrated on overlays that are drawn on top of or very close to the selected actor.

data.title: Units on defend stance trying to attack.
data.body:
When on defend stance units are attempting to attack despite their current stance and their range.

To see what I mean have an army of any kind. Let the enemy attack your army and with your own units selected hold down ALT. You will see target lines appearing on enemy units.

This is also apparent from current release.

data.title: Map lag
data.body:
What can cause a map to lag ? 

I've been playing this map http://resource.openra.net/maps/22951 (Jungle Law) several times online, with different people, and there seems to be a problem with the map causing the lag.

Could it be the interaction between ore and cliffs/trees ? (cf expansions at the back of each base)

data.title: Require explicit implementation on some more interfaces
data.body: Self-explanatory.

data.title: Can't release minelaying order on a previous mine
data.body: When issuing a surface minelaying order (Ctrl-RMB), it is not possible to release RMB it on a previously placed mine.

data.title: Cooldown on healing
data.body:
A medic blob can turn an infantry blob almost invincible : 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sbHfPqXKf-0&t=2m13s

This is due to the fact that a single unit can be healed instantly by several medics, soaking damage indefinitely. 

Therefore, I suggest there should be a cooldown on how fast a unit can be healed (similar to the weapon cooldown). See it as if 1 medic heals 1 unit, so a group of medics would still be useful healing several  damaged units, but not the same single unit. 

Not sure if it should be applied to mechanics.

data.title: Populate MapLocations from LoadMaps.
data.body:
Fixes #14066 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13922#issuecomment-326042177. 

Test deb package: [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xetqxm17e2m57kn/openra_test.20170626_all.deb?dl=1)

data.title: Add minelayers to command bar + polish fixes.
data.body:
* Fixes deploy key not working for mine layers
* Fixes #5620
* Fixes missing voice feedback
* Hides ugly cell overlay when using the deploy key

I would like to pick at least the first and third commits to prep, but see no reason not to take all of them - they are low risk polish and we are going to need at least one more playtest before the release.

data.title: Movement is canceling via by full cells.
data.body:
Currently in the new playtest (20170923) units are not moving to the closest cells to their destinations. Instead what is happening is when mobs of infantry occupy the cells that those units are trying to reach as their destination all movement orders cancels. This also includes those infantry units on the move to that spot and creates a line of units back behind the group.

To re-create this issue have a decent sized army of any unit type. Have vehicles on one key and infantry on another key. Move them to the same cell locations and this will trigger the issue.

This also affects RA. In TD its noticable as well but for some reason it seems like attack move is canceling out as well. I haven't been able to reproduce this just yet.

EDIT: This also seems to have an issue with ore trucks and harvesters temporarily canceling out when that dump area is blocked by another harvester/ore truck.

data.title: Fix global chat history buffer timestamps.
data.body: Fixes #14068.

data.title: Added Allies-06b to the Red Alert mod
Fix and polish AttackMoveOrderGenerator
data.body:
Fixes #14064 and a few other issues that made the attack move order generator inconsistent with the regular one.

~~The final commit is currently a WIP, @reaperrr is working on proper artwork for the `-blocked` cursors.~~

data.title: DedicatedLoop Is now ignored
data.body: Server will continuously loop regardless of what the DedicatedLoop boolean is set as

data.title: The timestamps in Global Chat get updated to the current time
data.body: When leaving and rejoining a server (and ending a game), all the timestamps of the Global Chat are changed to the current time. Here are screenshots of the same lines of chat:

data.title: NUnit 3.0.1 dependency now listed in .csproj
data.body:
Changed NUnit version in OpenRA.Test.csproj to 3.0.1, to be same as listed in fetch-thirdparty-deps.ps1.
Also updated public key token to reflect new version of library.
As requested in #14045 .

data.title: Unable to install maps in lobby on Ubuntu (playtest-20170923)
data.body:

The problem seems to be folder permissions as the map folders are owned by `root`.

data.title: Transport boats should spawn outside the sub pen
data.body:
Having them drive through the far-too-small doors looks unpolished.

#13208 fixes this, but needs someone to take charge of rebasing and reviewing it. This is a nice polish fix, so adding to Next + 1 in the hopes that we can get it done sooner rather than later.

data.title: Iron curtain effect transfered to MCV on deploy.
data.body:
First i hope i post this in the right place.

I noticed that IC effect shuts off when passing from conyard to mcv and from mcv top conyard
I was wondering is it is intended, a bug, something that never been reported or never bothered people.

I would gladly see the effect transfered one to another.

Example 

Lone MCV caught off guard, saved by IC and can deploy in MCV still under IC protection for the remaining time.

Conyard about to die, saved by IC, repacked and still under IC effect while getting away.

Both thing sounds good to me.

data.title: IPv6 - Basic support.
data.body:
This changes **do not affect / invalidate** the discussion https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13125 which is about implementing server - masterserver - client communication and session management.
This changes make the engine listen on incomming ipv6 connections too, which can be joined by using the direct-connect feature. This is extremely useful for testing in-development mods currently while the discussion mentioned above is not over and implemented yet.

Note: I am unable to test wether this will break anything on environments where IPv6 is not available at all and only IPv4 is available, as i do not have this environment. So it would be nice if someone could verify wether the default behavior still works.

data.title: Allow mods to override WithSpriteTurret.TurretOffset.
data.body:
This allows mods to rely on stock turret logic while providing their own implementation how to correctly position the turret on the actor.

Example usage: For KKnD i cannot rely on a formula to position turrets right, i need the position set per-frame. Position however is for rendering only and has no impact on logic. I could copy the whole WithSpriteTurret class instead of overriding the method, but that would break other traits depending on this trait, requiring them to be copied as well etc. So this is far the most easy method to not change any core behavior, but allow my custom trait to use another placement calculation.
